homeAutomation

Class Automation

  • java.lang.Object
    • homeAutomation.Automation

  • public class Automation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible for managing automations. An automation links two components together. Changing the status of a triggerComp to the triggeStatus will automatically change the status of the responseComp to the responseStatus.
    Author:
    tblijlevens

    • Constructor Detail

      • Automation

        public Automation(java.lang.String name,
                  Component triggerComp,
                  boolean triggerStatus,
                  Component responseComp,
                  boolean responseStatus)
        Constructor creates a new Automation with given name, and trigger and response components and statuses.
        Parameters:
        name - the name this Automation is given
        triggerComp - the component on which a status change should trigger this automation.
        triggerStatus - the status that triggerComp should change to, to trigger this automation.
        responseComp - the component that should change it's status in response to the trigger
        responseStatus - the status that responseComp should get

      • triggerAutomation

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> triggerAutomation(java.util.ArrayList<Automation> automations)
        Responsible for changing the status of the responseComp, triggering the right automations based on that status change and returning a list of the triggered automations (including chain triggered automations). Automations will only trigger if the status of the responseComp was changed (e.g. when setting false to false nothing triggers)
        Parameters:
        automations - the given list of automations from a HAManager instance in which this method should look for other automations to trigger
        Returns:
        a list of names of the triggered automations. If this automation triggers other automations (by changing a status of a component), they in turn will return a list of names to this Automation instance, which will add them to its own return list of names. The first triggered automation (called on by the HAManager) will therefore always return all the names of all the triggered automations, including all chain triggered automations.
